p: The increased amount of greenhouse gases in the atmosphere, which is also intimately linked to human development ( Fig. 4), is among the man-made causes of climate change ( Shepherd, 2012, Müller et al., 2013). Since the Industrial Revolution, increased greenhouse gas emissions (e.g., combustion of fossil fuels for electricity and heat generation, transportation, and manufacturing, land use changes) have greatly contributed to the natural greenhouse gas effect ( Malhi et al., 2002).
